security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation skill containing only markdown files with CSS/SCSS code examples. All 209 static findings are false positives: the scanner confused markdown code block backticks with Ruby backtick execution, HSL color values like '222.2 84% 4.9%' with weak cryptographic algorithms, and benign documentation patterns with system reconnaissance. No executable code, network calls, file system access, or command execution exists in this skill.

content.user_title: Apply shadcn/ui design principles to CSS
content.value_statement: Generate professional, accessible CSS that matches the clean shadcn/ui aesthetic. This skill provides comprehensive patterns for CSS variables, HSL colors, spacing scales, and modern layout techniques.
actual_capabilities: Generate CSS with CSS variables for complete theming
Apply HSL color system for colors with opacity support
Implement subtle, layered shadows and smooth transitions
Create accessible focus states with focus-visible
Build dark mode support into all components
limitations: Provides patterns and guidance, does not execute code
Does not install or configure dependencies
Does not modify existing files without explicit request
Focused on CSS/SCSS, not JavaScript or framework logic

best_practices: Use CSS variables for everything that needs theming
Apply HSL color format to enable easy opacity manipulation
Maintain consistent spacing using the 4px base scale
anti_patterns: Avoid hard-coded hex colors without variables
Do not use random pixel values for spacing
Never remove outline without providing focus-visible replacement

faq.question: Does this skill work with Tailwind CSS?
faq.answer: Yes, the principles work alongside Tailwind. Use CSS variables for theme values that need to work across both.

faq.question: What frameworks support this pattern?
faq.answer: Works with any web framework including React, Vue, Blazor, Svelte, and plain HTML/CSS projects.

faq.question: How does dark mode work?
faq.answer: Define colors in :root for light mode, then override in .dark class. Components automatically adapt.

faq.question: Can I use this for existing projects?
faq.answer: Yes, apply patterns incrementally. Start with new components, then refactor existing ones.

faq.question: Does it support CSS-in-JS?
faq.answer: Yes, the variable patterns work with styled-components, emotion, and other CSS-in-JS solutions.

faq.question: How do I customize the theme?
faq.answer: Modify the CSS variable values in :root. Change colors, spacing, radius, and shadows to match your brand.
